title: Home
text:
Welcome to my personal website! Iâ€™m currently pursuing a Master of Science in Applied Business Analytics at Boston University, with a background in Economics from Stony Brook University.
My interests lie at the intersection of data analytics, marketing strategy, and technology. I have hands-on experience with tools such as SQL, Power BI, R, and AWS Cloud, and have interned at companies like NetEase and Zhi Jin Human Resources.
Outside academics, I enjoy anime culture, running, and community events. Iâ€™ve served as a club accountant and data manager, which sharpened both my leadership and data organization skills.
Iâ€™m passionate about using data to solve real-world problems and am currently seeking opportunities in data analytics, marketing insights, or product strategy.

title: Home
text:
Repository: GitHub
Live Demo: Visit Website



This project was developed as part of the AD688 course at Boston University.
Our team (Group 6) focused on analyzing current job market trends to provide data-driven insights into salary, job requirements, and career planning.
The main research question:
How do salary and compensation trends differ across roles, regions, and job types in 2024?





Tools: Python, Pandas, Power BI, Quarto

Topics: Data visualization, salary analytics, career strategy

Roles: Team collaboration, writing, web presentation






Created a fully functional and responsive Quarto website for the project

Delivered insights on job market shifts and how students can align their skillsets

Received positive feedback on clarity, professionalism, and design
